properties.name: Caribou Falls State Wayside
properties.comments: Superior Hiking Trail access. A 3/4 mile trail along the Caribou River to Caribou Falls (35-ft waterfall), and also provides stunning views of Lake Superior and the Caribou River gorge. [Note: No sanitation facilities and No picnic tables].
properties.notes: Beautiful hike and huge waterfall off a Superior Hiking Club spur trail

properties.name: Carley State Park
properties.notes: Virginia Bluebells and White Trout Lilies bloom in May.

properties.comments: Croft Mine historic site

properties.name: Devils Track Falls State Wayside
properties.comments: Access to Devils Track is off the Gunflint Trail via the Superior Hiking Trail. It is a two-mile hike, one way, to reach the wayside. From here you can visit Pincushion Mountain, a rock outcrop overlooking Lake Superior. [Note: No sanitation facilities and No picnic tables].

properties.name: Flandrau State Park
properties.activities: Groomed snowshoe trails, Hiking trails, Snowshow rental

properties.name: Flood Bay State Wayside
properties.comments: One of the top beach walks along the North Shore. A long pebble beach along the shores of Lake Superior, just outside Two Harbors. [Note: One vault toilet and No picnic tables].

properties.name: Inspiration Peak State Wayside
properties.comments: A winding trail to the summit passes through a beautiful hardwood forest that opens to an expanse of rolling prairie hills. Rising 400 feet above the surrounding countryside, Inspiration Peak offers spectacular views in three directions. The native prairie on the top of the peak has been there for hundreds of years, and showcases many beautiful prairie wildflowers. Nobel Prize-winning novelist Sinclair Lewis shared his passion for this peak with his readers. [Note: Sanitation facilities and picnic tables present].
properties.notes: Shorter hike, around 15-mins round-trip, but steep throughout.

properties.name: Interstate State Park
properties.comments: Rock formations

properties.name: Iron Range Off-Highway Vehicle State Recreation Area
properties.comments: Visit Minnesota's premier off-highway vehicle recreation area to ride 36 miles of scenic trails such as Attitude Alley, Quartz Mountain, and Jackpine Lane. No entrance fee required. Open daily May through October; weekends only with limited staffing late November to April.
properties.activities: Day-use only, OHV trails, Picnic shelter

properties.name: Itasca State Park
properties.comments: Mississippi River Headwaters, Fire tower

properties.name: Jay Cooke State Park

properties.notes: The swinging bridge offers incredible views, especially of fall colors. Drive a bit further north to hike Ely's peak, an incredible view just south of Duluth. Stay in the Basalt camper cabin.

properties.name: John A. Latsch State Park
properties.comments: A half-mile hike (592 steps) up the deep ravine to Charity Peak for a panoramic view of the Mississippi River Valley

properties.name: Joseph R. Brown State Wayside
properties.comments: 2012 marked 150 years since the U.S.-Dakota War of 1862. This wayside features the ruins of Joseph R. Brown's three-story mansion, destroyed during the Dakota War of 1862. [Note: No sanitation facilities and one picnic tables present].

properties.name: Lake Vermilion-Soudan Underground Mine State Park
properties.comments: Lander Mattson Peak; Journey a half-mile underground to explore the world of mining or tour a fascinating physics lab. This park preserves five miles of shoreline and public access to a 40,000-acre lake with 368 islands. Hike the 2.4-mile Alaska Shaft trail for an overview.
properties.notes: Book the mine tour, you won't be disappointed!
